data.title: Git doesn't work when user has non-ASCII characters

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

When trying to pull/push/fetch/etc., I'm getting error:
```
Could not create directory '/c/Users/[username]/.ssh'.
Host key verification failed.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.
```

It was working before update, and also works perfectly fine from cmd (standard windows command line).

data.title: [FR]Add ability to let extensions pick files + folders
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4

Extensions sometimes need file or folder names to create new files and hence have the need to ask the user for a file/folder name. Currently this is only possible via the input box, which is rather inconvenient. It would be nice if there were APIs for extension writers which trigger the native OS file/folder selection box (just like what "Save As" for editors is using, similar for load file and select folder).

data.title: previewHTML doesn't expand to full editor with
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open any .md file with the markdown preview extension (or use any other extension that works with previewHTML).
2. See the vertical scrollbar is not at the right hand side but a good part moved to the left. I might be wrong but it looks as if that is the size used by the minimap (if switched on).

data.title: Git doesn't work any more.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T14:00:34.044Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|file-icons|file-icons|1.0.3|
|auto-rename-tag|formulahendry|0.0.11|
|path-autocomplete|ionutvmi|1.4.1|
|docthis|joelday|0.4.3|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.59|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.5.1|
|guides|spywhere|0.7.0|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Upgrade to v1.11.1
2. Open an git repo with some files untracked
3. Open the git tab from the left tab list
4. No files can be shown up in this tab.

After upgraded to the latest version(v1.11.1), I noticed that the git tab doesn't work any more, no more data can be shown up except a title "SOURCE CONTROL" and an empty input fields with a placeholder like the screenshot below.

Have tried to remove all the extensions and delete all my custom settings, git doesn't come back.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12368943/24859526/8b1b7f00-1e23-11e7-82a9-b9d53774ec5c.png)

data.title: Preview Git SCM cannot create branches from status bar
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-caniuse|agauniyal|0.5.0|
|Handlebars|andrejunges|0.2.0|
|vscode-yarn-script|carlosjs23|0.0.1|
|jsrefactor|cmstead|1.0.2|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-npm|fknop|3.3.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|
|ColdFusion|SketchPunk|0.0.1|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.0.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open workspace with git repo
2. Click branch name in status bar
3. Enter new branch name

Expected results:

* New branch created and checked out

Actual results:

* Nothing happens, as the status bar command is "Checkout to..." which in the Preview Git SCM doesn't allow branch creation (there's a separate "Create branch..." command for that)

data.title: Preview Git SCM doesn't show correct diffs in remote workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:58:12.954Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-caniuse|agauniyal|0.5.0|
|Handlebars|andrejunges|0.2.0|
|vscode-yarn-script|carlosjs23|0.0.1|
|jsrefactor|cmstead|1.0.2|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-npm|fknop|3.3.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.3|
|ColdFusion|SketchPunk|0.0.1|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.0.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a workspace on a Windows/Samba network share
2. Initialise git repo
3. Create file with some contents and commit
4. Modify file
5. Try to compare file from SCM panel

Expected results:

* Correctly working diff

Actual results:

* Working Tree diff shows entire file as new
* Index diff shows empty diff

Notes:

This is definitely related to the Preview Git SCM, as disabling it returns to working diffs and re-enabling it breaks them.

data.title: editor.occurrencesHighlight should be honoured by SelectionHighlighter
data.body:
Whole words are highlighted through two different code paths:

* if there exists a `DocumentHighlightProvider` (i.e. smart async language support exists), then `WordHighlighter` invokes the provider and it respects `editor.occurrencesHighlight`.

* if there is no `DocumentHighlightProvider` (i.e. smart async language support is missing), then `SelectionHighlighter` tries to compensate and highlights whole words.

The `SelectionHighlighter` should also respect `editor.occurrencesHighlight` in the cases where it is compensating for a lack of rich language support.

data.title: Ctrl + Shift + F5 to start debugger even if the debugger isn't currently running

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Would be handy to have the Visual Studio type functionality where the debugger starts using the "Restart Debugger" command even if it isn't running.

data.title: enumerable.forEach autocomplete adds additional '.array.forEach' using intellisense
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an array and add a few elements. 
2. Create a function and, using intellisense, write a `forEach` loop for the array you've just made as such:

```
var myArr = [1, 2, 3];

myArr.forE
```

press tab to complete the forEach statement

3. Autocomplete creates the statement, but adds in `myArr.array.forEach` and sets focus to `array` to be changed.

Would be nice to be able to autocomplete the foreach on a predefined array without needing to remove the `array` element from the statement when using autocomplete.

data.title: show the tips when the cursor is on the code that has error or warning

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
_From @viix on April 6, 2017 5:48_

For now, if you want to see the eslint issue tip, you have to move the mouse to the code with wavy underline. I think it's better to support that when the input cursor move to the code, it shows the issue tip. Especially when using vim extension, it will be more convenient.

_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-eslint#225_

data.title: Start.js wrongly recognized as a program attribute
data.body:
Refs #24403

1. Create a new react starter workspace
```
npm install -g create-react-app
create-react-app my-app
```
2. Open it in vscode, open a js file and click on the green start debug icon
3. Notice that the wrong file is chosen as the "program" attribute to start debugging
4. This file does not even exist, and is somehow computed from this package.json

Note: that I am still in the process of figuring out how to debug this but we should not pick a non-existent file in any case

```json
{
  "name": "react-app",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "dependencies": {
    "react": "^15.5.3",
    "react-dom": "^15.5.3"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "react-scripts": "0.9.5"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "react-scripts start",
    "build": "react-scripts build",
    "test": "react-scripts test --env=jsdom",
    "eject": "react-scripts eject"
  }
}
```

![screen shot 2017-04-10 at 11 29 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/24855142/f1ada1e6-1de0-11e7-84f3-364f43394280.png)

data.title: Watching task always spins in status bar and makes me dizzy
data.body:
Refs: #24403

1. Start a watching task
2. Notice that the status bar is always spinning -> looking at it for a longer time is a very unpleasent experience

Can we notify the user in some better way that a task is watching and will never finish

![spinspinspin](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/24854905/406d309a-1de0-11e7-934d-b3dfbb661e40.gif)

data.title: Tasks does not live react to changes in tasks.json
data.body:
Refs: #24403

insiders, mac

1. New workspace, setup a task runner, choose npm
2. Run task -> notice 3 options, great
3. Go back to tasks.json, add a new task, for instance
```json
{
            "taskName": "start",
            "args": ["start"]
        }
```
4. save tasks.json, f1 > run task -> notice the newest task added is not in the list, only the previous 3 are there

data.title: Exception peek UI doesn't seem to function for me on version 1.18
data.body:
_From @StephenBloomquist on April 6, 2017 19:58_

This is with VSCode version 1.11.1

In trying to move my debugger to version 1.18 of the protocol and adapter, but the exception UI (the red bar that spans the screen with exception details) no longer displays. My usage of stopped event hadn't changed between versions, and everything else about the exception behaves as expected.

I get these errors when I try resizing the debug side bar, which seem like they're relevant due to the exception widget calls in the stack trace:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24838721/24772953/12c23dea-1ac8-11e7-8112-c53202611939.png)




_Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node#110_

data.title: `isShellCommand` on task level should be honored or disallowed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->
```ts
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "npm",
    "suppressTaskName": true,
    "tasks": [
        {
            "isBuildCommand": true,
            "isShellCommand": true, <<<<< Does not work. Command is interpreted as executable.
            "echoCommand": true,
            "taskName": "version",
            "args": ["--version"]
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Remove hot exit is now the default message
data.body: /cc @bpasero

data.title: 'git checkout' in quickOpen (Ctrl+P)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In VSCode 1.10 and earlier, I could do `Ctrl+P`, `git checkout` and it would offer me the list of branches. It was a very nice and smooth workflow.

In VSCode 1.11, this seems to be gone. The new "Git: Checkout to..." is the replacement.

Is there any chance that the original way would be reintroduced (maybe the current state is just a limitation of the SCM provider infrastructure), or is it going to stay the way it is?

Note: somewhat related is https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21439 (_Can no longer create branch_).

data.title: js colorization without white space
Error messages/warnings banner hiding file tabs
data.body:
If I get an error or a warning in VS Code it is shown in a banner in the top of the page. The banner hides the file tabs and I cannot close the banner.

Please add a way to close the banners so that I can work with the file tabs.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code when there is an error in a 

![error message hiding tabs in vs code](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10065732/24850804/be62f746-1dd1-11e7-8540-a30bbece2aa2.png)

data.title: c++ warnings disappears after project rebuild
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.1 (d9484d12b38879b7f4cdd1150efeb2fd2c1fbf39, 2017-04-06T13:55:56.395Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-53-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.5|
|cmake|twxs|0.0.17|
|cmake-tools|vector-of-bool|0.9.4|
|debug|webfreak|0.17.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add a code that generates a warning - add an unused variable, for example.
2. Build a project with a task (I'm using gcc).
3. Observe a warning in the Problems tab.
4. Rebuild the project.
5. The warning is missing now.
